section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries

entries.text: ABSTRACT: Li metal combines the advantages of low redox potential and high theoretical specific capacity, being an ideal candidate anode for high energy density secondary batteries.

section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries

entries.text: However, Li-metal anode tends to grow dendrites that are highly reactive to electrolyte and cause issues such as fast capacity decaying and safety risk.

section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries

entries.text: To address these issues, we propose a Lilean anode featuring Ag plumes on Cu substrate.

section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries

entries.text: The Ag plumes are grown on Cu substrate by immersing Cu foil in AgF aqueous solution, and the Li-lean anode is fabricated by depositing Li on the grown Ag plumes.

section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries

entries.text: Thanks to the large specific surface area and the low Li depositing/stripping overpotential of the Ag plumes, the as-fabricated Li-lean anode allows the cell to match with LiFePO_{4}

section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries

entries.text: cathode with excellent cyclic stability.

section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries

entries.text: Compared with the bare Cu electrode, the as-fabricated Li-lean anode improves the capacity retention of the cell with a LFP loading of  $0.4 \text{ mAh cm}^{-2}$  from 9 to 81% after 300 cycles at 1 C between 2.0 and 4.0 V. The facile formation of Ag plumes makes it possible for high energy density Li-metal batteries to be applied in a large scale.

entries.text: KEYWORDS: Ag plumes, Cu substrate, Li-lean anode, Li-metal batteries, cyclic stability

entries.text: High energy density rechargeable batteries are urgently needed to meet the requirements of electricity-driving devices for sizes to be as compact and for working time to be as long as possible.

entries.text: 1-3 Li-ion batteries based on graphite anode provide the highest energy density among currently commercialized rechargeable batteries but cannot match the requirements above.

section_path: Ag Plumes Grown on Cu for Li-Lean Anode of High Energy Density Li-Metal Batteries
1. INTRODUCTION

entries.text: Therefore, searching for the substitutes for graphite has attracted much attention.4-7 Li metal is an ideal candidate for replacing graphite because it has the lowest potential (-3.04)V) and high theoretical specific capacity (3860 mAh g^{-1}).^{8-11} However, its active chemical property makes it difficult to be used in practice.^{12} On one hand, due to the direct contact of lithium with the organic electrolytes, the uncontrolled interface reactions between the electrolytes and the lithium metal lead to the loss of active lithium, the depletion of the electrolyte, and the accumulation of reaction products, 13 which are responsible for the increase in interface impedance of anode/ electrolyte and the fast capacity decaying of Li-metal batteries.
